titles.title: Camera Phone Predator Alert Act
To require mobile phones containing digital cameras to make a sound when a photograph is taken.

bill.summary: 9/6/2007--Introduced. Camera Phone Predator Alert Act - Requires any mobile phone containing a digital camera to sound a tone whenever a photograph is taken with the camera's phone. Prohibits such a phone from being equipped with a means of disabling or silencing the tone. Treats the requirement as a consumer product safety standard and requires enforcement by the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC).
